pageContext.claim: “They purge newsrooms of reporters who do not swear allegiance to their false narratives. You've seen some reporters are extremely upset, they end up getting absolutely decimated. They censor stories that reveal the corruption of their chosen candidate.”
pageContext.analysis: This is nonsense. Mainstream newsrooms do not create “false narratives.” There are checks and cross checks to ensure that reporting is accurate. When a mistake is made and something incorrect makes it to print, a correction is issued. Reporters are only fired when these errors amount to made up stories or happen on a frequent basis. Moreover, they do not “censor” stories in favor of any candidate.
